title: When a teammate pick intends Yasuo

replies.body: Seems like a good idea until hes trolling your game with ap zed

The kinds of people who troll over you banning Yasuo are the kinds of people who feed uncontrollably as Yasuo

The good Yasuo players have come to terms with Yasuo being banned a lot and already have a second champion in mind

But you don't know if they're good or bad until after you ban him which is a catch 22 :[
I trust a feeding yasuo more than a teammate who bans an ally's pick

That's fair. Personally I always look the person in question up on op.gg and only ban their pick if it's like... under a 30% win rate. But I'm sure there's a lot of people who just blindly go "Lawl I don't want a Yas on my team" and bans them. 

And then that person usually feeds a lot, too.
Malphite main here, I ban yas anytime I can. In ranked the best score a yasuo ever had on my team was 2/12/3
Now to play the devil's advocate here, if you ban your team's Yas every game, that stats never gonna change lol
I used to let him go if I see some1 on my team pick him, but inside im begging the enemy team to ban him.

Sometimes even that doesn't help. Once I had a Fiora, who was intentionally feeding, because I had banned Yasuo. She was in the enemy team though. Happening once in so many games is nothing, really, but damn, it was funny af
1 trick yas mains are the scum of LoL
To be fair I hate Yasuo more than anything in the game, but I have seen Yausos who are pretty nice guys. I have seen toxic players playing all kind of champions, so it is not always the Yasuo OTP
we all believe that Yasuo will feed :)
i caught 22 once. took me a while to get rid of it.

That awkward moment when you've seen an AP Zed beat an AD Zed.

Oh, Bronze, how you never cease to amuse me.

video plsssssss

If no vid, please get one next time :)
I would, but it was well over a year ago. Back when I was level 25, I think.
Damn, that sounds hilarious though.

The worst thing about Yasuo is his hate circlejerk.

http://i.imgur.com/oyjb1pd.gif?b

I'd say that the worst thing about yasuo is the fact that until D2 players ignore wave management, and his kit revolves entirely around wave management, also their lv2 engages where they facetank 2 minion waves and die so they start flaming the jungler (which hasn't killed the second buff yet) and spamming help pings, especially when the jungler is something like shyvana/graves/yi/kindred. (god bless the ping mute button)

>until D2 players ignore wave management, (...) also their lv2 engages where they facetank 2 minion waves and die (...)

Waht Deh Fukc.
Followed by those of his players, who do not speak memes and games

League community: YASUO ALWAYS FEEDS

Also League community: NERF YASUO SOO OP
Yasuo only feeds when he is in your team dude
Known as the “Shaco-syndrome“: A champion that seemingly allways carries when on the enemy team, but feeds when on your own team.
I thought that was Vayne-syndrome
I thought it was Riven-syndrome
Shaco's Law
Then why do you want him nerfed xd
Then he would feed in enemy team as well so it would be equalized :D
3-10 Yasuos will end up 1-15 xd
enemy yasuos do not end up 3-10. If they reach 3-10 they get a penta with 2 items and finish right after and end up 8-10
the people like you make me laugh so hard "two items penta" the spike is huge but not like that
Considering it's memes and games I'd take making you laugh as a compliment {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I didn't get that vibe add a little face at the end it helps :p
upvoted for the :P in the end. WP!
lol tx
all the hate on yasuo makes me not hate him anymore...
good, less people hating him - smaller chance my ban to be duplicated :D
Oh well when I hated him i never banned him... Soooo. not really less people banning him.
http://www.lovethispic.com/uploaded_images/49756-At-Least-I-Tried.jpg
http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/yt.gif

I've actually had a lot of success with yasuo's on my team. That could also be because I play a lot of lift champions: {{champion:150}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:53}}. So maybe it's just a question of knowing how to utilize one on your team rather than him trying to fend for himself?
It is more about the perception, the way something feels, rather how it actually is. For example I don't think you are wrong, but bringing logic and reason in memes and games feels wrong. kappa
It's always a nice thing to do to ban your own teammate out.
ban it
